content: stretchy cast off with beaded picots row 17 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k8 k7 sl 2 sts purlwise k8 x14 k7 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 rs knit 2 sts place both sts back on the left needle and *k2 sts together through the back loop knit 1 st put both row 19 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st rt lt k7 k6 rt lt sts back on left needle and repeat from * until you reach k7 x14 k6 rt lt k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 the first p symbol above the last charted row the picot row 21 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 rt k2 lt k6 k5 starts at this column of stitches you should have a single rt k2 lt k6 x14 k5 rt k2 lt k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st stitch slip it to the left needle and cast on 3 stitches place k2 a bead on the last stitch cast off those three stitches as follows k2 pass 1st st over 2nd st k 1 pass 1st st over 2nd st row 23 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k6 rt lt k7 x15 k6 3 times work the stretchy cast off until you reach the next rt lt k6 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 p symbol and repeat the beaded picot procedure row 25 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k3 k3 ssk yo 2/1rc continue in this way until you reach the last picot work 2/1lc yo k2tog k4 x16 k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 that picot and then work the stretchy cast off until one stitch remains cut yarn and thread through loop row 27 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k1 yo k2tog k3 k2 ssk yo 2/1rc k2 2/1lc yo k2tog k3 x16 k2 ssk yo k1 weave in ends wet and block pinning out the picots above k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 the quadruple yarn over most aggressively so as to create a scalloped edge row 29 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 2/1lc yo k2tog k2 k1 ssk yo 2/1rc yo ssk k2tog yo 2/1lc yo k2tog written directions for lace section k2 x16 k1 ssk yo 2/1rc k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 repeat section is indicated in square brackets if you are row 31 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st yo ssk k2 k2tog working the larger version you will work additional repeats 2/2lc yo sk2p yo 2/2rc yo ssk k2 k2tog yo 2/2lc yo sk2p x16 yo 2/2rc yo ssk k2 k2tog yo k1 yo k1 into 1 chart a st k2 row 1 rs k2 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k1 k6 lt rt k7 x12 k1 yo k1 into 1 st k2 biophilia copyright © mary-anne mace 2015 this pattern is for personal use only
